TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataListItem extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl implements class System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

type DataListItem = class inherit WebControl interface IDataItemContainer interface INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an item in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object represents an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control, such as a heading section, a footer section, or a data item.
The data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control are stored in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> that can be accessed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
You can use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> to programmatically access the properties of an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> to display the contents of each data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a data item associated with the object in the control.
Docs.value: An that represents a data item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.DataItem%2A> property to specify or determine the properties of a data item associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property only applies to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object must be set to one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType> enumeration values.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.DataItem%2A> property to display the contents of the data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
[!code-aspx-csharp[DataListItemCreated#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListItemCreated/CS/datalistitemcreatedcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataListItemCreated#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListItemCreated/VB/datalistitemcreatedvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemIndex%2A> property to determine the index number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection.
> [!NOTE] > This property only applies to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object must be set to `ListItemType.Item`, `ListItemType.AlternatingItem`, `ListItemType.SelectedItem`, or `ListItemType.EditItem`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemIndex%2A> property to display the index number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection of the control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the item represented by the object in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property to determine the type of the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object. The following table lists the various item types.
|Item Type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |`Header`|The heading section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Footer`|The footer section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Item`|An item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`AlternatingItem`|An alternating item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`SelectedItem`|The selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`EditItem`|The item selected for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Separator`|A separator between the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Pager`|The page selection section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property to determine the item type of the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object. The order that items are created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is displayed along with the item type.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
[!code-aspx-csharp[DataListItemCreated#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListItemCreated/CS/datalistitemcreatedcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataListItemCreated#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListItemCreated/VB/datalistitemcreatedvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's property is .
Docs.value: if the property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than 4.0; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled. If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled. If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.DataItem%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to retrieve the data object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.System%23Web%23UI%23IDataItemContainer%23DataItem%2A> member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.

block.para: To define a custom implementation for retrieving the data object for a , override the member. The explicit interface implementation uses the property to retrieve the associated data object.
